abstracts.cdata!:
Although the main project objective was
            fully achieved, the deterioration of the utility's
            (EdH) efficiency and uncertain project sustainability makes
            the overall outcome unsatisfactory. While the performance of
            the International Development Association (IDA) is
            satisfactory overall, Borrower's performance is
            unsatisfactory. Some key lessons learned are: EdH is not
            financially viable under the present institutional
            arrangements because they do not entail sufficient
            incentives, autonomy, or private involvement. The main cause
            for EdH's low income is the high level of electricity
            losses which have steadily grown since the first power
            project. Failure to achieve the loss-reduction objective was
            due in part to inadequately preparing a comprehensive
            program during project preparation. The Staff Appraisal
            Report should included a political risk analysis whenever
            the political environment is unstable; this analysis should
            include the utility's financial projection and base it
            on historical levels of efficiency. Government support,
            including use of public force, is essential to ensure that
            Edh has safe access to neighborhoods and to prevent
            non-paying customers' from reselling electricity. The
            lack of adequate maintenance is another crucial issue linked
            to lacking financial resources. The government has initiated
            actions to concession EDH to a private company, which should
            bring in new capital indispensable for expanding the
            facilities and drastically reducing electricity losses.
